news.title: Nikita Hand to sue her two former neighbours and Conor McGregor over withdrawn claims in failed appeal
news.summary: Nikita Hand has initiated new proceedings against Conor McGregor and two would-be witnesses whose evidence was dramatically withdrawn from the mixed martial arts fighter’s failed appeal.

news.title: ‘We will never stop searching, we’ll never give up, we’ll always be searching for Fiona’ – 27 years later Sinnott family seeks answers
news.summary: Yesterday, in a sleepy south Wexford village, the Sinnott family were keeping a vigil.

news.title: Judge gives widow of ‘Fat’ Andy Connors three months to come up with €5,000 in social welfare fraud case
news.summary: The widow of burglary gang boss ‘Fat’ Andy Connors has been given just over three months to pay the €5,000 she owes the State after pleading guilty to a sample count of deception against the Department of Social Protection.

news.title: The Indo Daily: Patrick Kielty and Cat Deeley’s shock split: A nation obsessed with celebrity romance
news.summary: We’re a nation obsessed with knowing.

news.title: ‘Sitting in a deckchair wouldn’t cause fear’ – trespassing case against grandfather (84) dismissed
news.summary: An elderly man who gathered with friends on a green area that is a designated public space has had a trespassing case against him dismissed.

news.title: ‘This is a Test match and we will play it as such’ – Scott Bemand welcomes return of Ireland duo for Scotland clash
news.summary: Ireland head coach Scott Bemand says their first World Cup warm-up game against Scotland in Cork tomorrow is about building momentum for the tournament kick-off in three weeks’ time.

news.title: Irish exports rise, but 15pc US tariffs on spirits and whiskey in effect from today
news.summary: Irish exports rose last month for the first time since March, with some evidence that efforts to find new overseas markets are proving successful.

news.title: Martina Devlin: At 81, why is it left to Mary Robinson to stand up for Palestinians when the EU won’t?
news.summary: Mary Robinson is a headline act. In a landmark address at the United Nations delivered with passion and precision, she spoke truth to power – her call to action over Gaza flagged the need to suspend trade co-operation and impose “a robust set of targeted sanctions” against Israel.

news.title: Ultimate August bank holiday event guide: Planes, parades, Pride, President Higgins and more
news.summary: This August bank holiday may not be a scorcher but it will still pack a punch in terms of the jam-packed programme of activities taking place across the country in the coming days.

news.title: Modern Morals: My childless sister-in-law criticises our kids’ table manners – how do I stop myself losing the rag with her?
